concept.title: Drawing Tools in Figma
concept.shortdesc: Drawing tools in Figma help create curated path networks that customize your design.

conbody.p: Figma's drawing tools account for three different kinds of brush strokes to make your designs take on a hand-drawn feel in digital spaces. The drawing tools contain vectorized brushes, advanced stroke settings, fills, and more!

section.title: Brushes
section.p: Brushed add hand-drawn elements to your designs for your projects. You can draw directly inside your Figma Design file using the pencil andbrush tools. These tools create vecotr networks by placing vector points along your drawing path. The vector points of your drawing can be edited using vector edit mode.
These brush styles can be further customized by creating single vecotr layers using shapes, flattened text layers, and custom vector paths.

section.title: Dynamic Strokes
section.p: Dynamic Strokes allow you to create visual representations of the vector's network path. The most common use for this feaure is adding borders to images, but you can also use this to create lines, arrows, and outlines.

section.title: Variable Width Strokes
section.p: This tool lets you change the wdith of the stroke at any point in the path to create variance in the line.
